RumorFact.Text: There is a second Quantum Moon Locator somewhere on Brittle Hollow.
Nomai at the Looming City wondered how differently the Second Locator functions from the Quantum Moon Locator on Ember Twin.
The Nomai decided to leave a set of eyes at the Quantum Moon Locator on Ember Twin to help them track the Quantum Moon.

ExploreFact.Text: A Nomai device in the Tower of Quantum Knowledge, built to track the Quantum Moon's location.
The limited view of the sky at the Second Locator makes it much harder to directly observe the Quantum Moon.
The Second Locator is unable to track the live position of the Quantum Moon, unlike Ember Twin's Quantum Moon Locator.
The Nomai decided to leave a set of eyes at the Quantum Moon Locator on Ember Twin to help them track the Quantum Moon.

RumorFact.Text: The Nomai built a perpetually active storm shelter on the Quantum Moon. They planned to use it to escape the strong winds at the sixth location.
A Nomai named Kousa promised to write the outcome of this plan on the projection wall inside the Tower of Quantum Knowledge.

ExploreFact.Text: The Nomai attempted to use a perpetual storm shelter to escape the strong winds at the Quantum Moon's sixth location, but their plan failed.
The Quantum Moon's thick atmosphere obscures its visitors' sight during entry, causing it to return to superposition.
The Quantum Moon's thick atmosphere impedes exit at the sixth location because one is unable to observe what exists beyond its clouds.

RumorFact.Text: The Nomai studying the Meteor Impact Model decided to bring an issue they noticed to the Nomai at the Hanging City.

ExploreFact.Text: The Nomai noticed that meteors from Hollow's Lantern would stray from paths they previously took during a timeloop.
The Nomai decided to build a structure in orbit around Brittle Hollow to study this discrepancy.
The warp tower to this structure was built on a site least likely to be impacted by meteors, and built across several pieces of Brittle Hollow's crust.
A simulation of where meteor impacts will occur on Brittle Hollow.
Two Nomai noticed periods of inaccuracy where meteors do not land as the model predicts.
The Nomai noticed a disturbing issue while studying this model. They decided to bring this issue to the Nomai at the Hanging City.

RumorFact.Text: Nomai on Giant's Deep visited this workshop on Brittle Hollow's equator to inquire about storm shelters activating in the absence of cyclones.
Storm shelters are powered by solar panels, not cyclones.

ExploreFact.Text: Storm shelters were engineered at this workshop to protect Nomai from strong winds on Giant's Deep.
The Sunless City contributed to the invention of the storm shelter, allowing the device to autonomously power on and off.
There is a scroll in a shelf in one of the ruins outside the workshop, but it is surrounded by ghost matter.

AltText.Text: Storm shelters are powered by solar panels, not cyclones.

ExploreFact.Text: The solar panels powering the storm shelters are tuned to detect even faint amounts of sunlight. Nomai on Giant's Deep reported some sort of issue with the storm shelter when the sun was directly overhead.

AltText.Text: The solar panels powering the storm shelters are tuned to detect even faint amounts of sunlight, causing storm shelters to activate when the sun is directly overhead.

ExploreFact.Text: All available gravity crystals at this workshop were transported to Giant's Deep to build something called the Inspired.
